message.content: {"id": "22360", "title": "Bug 22360[Fonts] FontRegistry can not be instantiated using resources outside org.eclipse.jface.resource", "description": "Bug 22360[Fonts] FontRegistry cannot be instantiated using resources outside org.eclipse.jface.resource. Therefore, all the resources that are being looked up are only relative to the location of the FontRegistry class, org.eclipse.jface.resource path. It can be remedied if FontRegistry takes a client class (or class loader) as an additional parameter to the constructor.", "OB": "Currently, FontRegistry does not support the instantiation of resources outside org.eclipse.jface.resource.", "EB": "Alternatively, it can allow clients to load their own resource bundle and pass it as a parameter to the constructor (instead of the name of the bundle).", "SR": "Modify the FontRegistry class to support the instantiation of resources outside org.eclipse.jface.resource by taking a client class or class loader as an additional parameter to the constructor, or allow clients to load their own resource bundle and pass it as a parameter to the constructor."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '22360', 'title': 'Bug 22360[Fonts] FontRegistry can not instantiated using resources outside org.eclipse.jface.resource', 'description': 'Bug 22360[Fonts] FontRegistry can not instantiated using resources outside org.eclipse.jface.resource Therefore all the resourcesthat are being looked up are the only ones relative to the location of theFontRegistry classorg.eclipse.jface.resource path.It can be remedied if FontRegistry took a client class (or class loader) as anadditional parameter to the constructor. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'Alternatively it can allow clients toload their own resource bundle and take it as a parameter to the constructor(Vs. name of the bundle). ', 'SR': ''}
